TopicTitle: KSP Twitter- "We've got something planned later today"

Articles.Content:
> 
> What was the first official mod?

The Kerbin Cup: [http://www.curse.com/ksp-mods/kerbal/221319-kerbin-cup](http://www.curse.com/ksp-mods/kerbal/221319-kerbin-cup)

Which hasn't been updated or even so much as recompiled since. No reason it shouldn't still work, but it'd be nice if it was at least bumped. 

Why release "official" mods instead of just stuffing them in the game?

> 
> They made [soccer balls](http://www.curse.com/ksp-mods/kerbal/221319-kerbin-cup) for the World Cup in 2014.

Oh yeah, I completely forgot about that!

Here's the new parts in-game for anyone at work, including:

 The HECS-2 Probe Core comes with integrated batteries and SAS, to make building a compact Sentinel probe much easier.

 The OX-STAT-XL Photovoltaic Panels are a much larger version of the stock solar panels, for larger probes.

 The HG-55 High Gain Antenna can transmit larger amounts of data than any of the existing antennae in the game.

![F3jqNuc.png](http://i.imgur.com/F3jqNuc.png)

![cTN9BhE.png](http://i.imgur.com/cTN9BhE.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-30T17:28:59Z" title="06/30/2015 05:28  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 30, 2015</time> by Yakuzi**
  
included the antenna
The new SENTINEL Infrared Telescope carries the number B-612. A nice easter egg leading to the [B612 foundation](http://sentinelmission.org/).

> Why release "official" mods instead of just stuffing them in the game?

Because I don't want useless soccer balls in my game by default, and I imagine many others don't either ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) The asteroid one though makes more sense to integrate into the game, but it seems silly to release a new update for something so minor.
Ok, this is pretty cool. I'm just going to consider this part of stock.

> 
> The asteroid one though makes more sense to integrate into the game, but it seems silly to release a new update for something so minor.

They've got to up Curse's download count over KerbalStuff with something...
Yay! Moar Science. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> They've got to up Curse's download count over KerbalStuff with something...

Curse's download count is already higher than KS' afaik. Having MechJeb exclusively will do that.
Ooooh, not bad!

> 
> It's a part pack with a probe with SAS, a bigger fixed solar panel, a dish antenna and an asteroid telescope. It contains also a mission pack. It's on Curse already...
> [http://kerbal.curseforge.com/ksp-mods/232196-asteroid-day](http://kerbal.curseforge.com/ksp-mods/232196-asteroid-day)
> 
> EDIT : Looks like the parts are from RoverDude, and nice one too, me like ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I saw this post before and I thought it was just his guess, but yeah. Also, I got ninja'd by two pages while I read the blog post.

I'm still underwhelmed ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-30T17:36:39Z" title="06/30/2015 05:36  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 30, 2015</time> by monstah**

> 
> Because I don't want useless soccer balls in my game by default, and I imagine many others don't either ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) The asteroid one though makes more sense to integrate into the game, but it seems silly to release a new update for something so minor.

I imagine they'll stuff it into the SQUAD folder like they did the ARM stuff come 1.1. Well played SQUAD, I like this one.

Looks very interesting.

Thanks, SQUAD.

Happy landings!

edit: Shiny!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-30T17:47:57Z" title="06/30/2015 05:47  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 30, 2015</time> by Starhawk**

Reading the reactions, it's clear you guys enjoyed a lot more than me.

I do admit they didn't hype too much this time, and it's not something I'm *completely* uninterested in.

I'm happy. It's not save breaking, Flight/physics in the Kerbol system didn't change, I can use the probe and the solar panel. Assuming the dish works with RT2, I can use that too. 

..and it's not asking me for more money!

It's a nice mod. I hope they'll integrate it into 1.05 stock because.. parts.

Finally, has anybody done the mission yet? Does it actually locate larger asteroids in the outer system? How much larger? That could\* really flesh out the late game potential.

Thanks SQUAD, hopefully more good news ahead!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-30T17:41:56Z" title="06/30/2015 05:41  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 30, 2015</time> by Violent Jeb**
  
Changed the word probe to probe from it's previous word, "pod"

> It's a nice mod. I hope they'll integrate it into 1.05 stock because.. parts.

Same.
Class Z Asteroids anyone? Imagine lugging around something 5 times the size of Gilly, with no gravity. Gilly would fall on *it!*
Does it work in 1.0.2?

they decide to release something new just when I am in the middle of Windows reinstall. Tough luck ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Though those are nice looking parts indeed

> 
> Does it actually locate larger asteroids in the outer system? How much larger? That could\* really flesh out the late game potential.

I don't believe it does. That would require altering the way asteroids spawn. IIRC there was a mod that would generate up to size class Q (which were almost as big as Gilly) and, when partnered with Custom Asteroids (or which let you change the orbital spawning parameters), you could do that (or maybe the class Q was a feature of Custom Asteroids).
Thanks, glad you dig the parts. Arsonide did some amazing work on the contract for it too!
Can someone post pictures of the new parts please?

oh! so...so I don't need this (\*puts pitch fork down).

Well that was a pleasant surprise, they look like nice parts too. Looking forward to trying them out later.

Will these remain an "official mod" or will they at some point get integrated into the core game?

- - - Updated - - -

Happy landings!
